title: Senior Manager, Partner Sourcing
content:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn’t just the Best Place to Play — it’s also the Best Place to Work. Today, we’re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, PlayStation®VR, PlayStation®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.Sr. Manager, Partner Sourcing (Open to remote, Worldwide)
PlayStation Studios is establishing a new Partner Sourcing Team that will support our studios with identifying, negotiating and managing outsourcing and co-development partners.
As this is the inaugural Partner Sourcing role, we are looking for a skilled individual with extensive experience to establish this team, collaborate with business stakeholders to build processes and help us advance the Partner Sourcing strategy.
This role requires strong vendor management skills and a solid understanding of the game development process and co-development best practices. This highly collaborative individual will have a proven track record for building successful partnerships and brings an extensive partner network.
This role will report into the Head of Development Strategy for PlayStation Studios.
The team’s goals will be to:

Enhance the outsourcing and co-development capability across our portfolio of studios.
Achieve sustainable deals that deliver on quality, pricing and crucial collaboration between PlayStation Studios and external partners.
Develop a long-term strategic view of PlayStation Studios’ outsourcing and co-development needs.
Continuously improve our internal processes working to streamline interactions with central functions, such as IT, Information Security, Legal and Finance.

PlayStation Studios takes a non-mandated sourcing approach that supports our studios’ creative autonomy.
RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Provide central outsourcing and co-development expertise to the studios.
Promote best practices for continuous improvement, chairing a forum of outsourcing managers across the studios.
Support studio outsourcing managers with vendor selection, negotiation, due diligence and onboarding.
Increase the volume and efficiency of outsourcing and co-development, facilitating cross-organization efforts and negotiate scalable agreements.
Build sustainable, symbiotic relationships with key vendors.
Use studio forecasts to create strategic mid-to long-term roadmaps for planned engagements.
Work with stakeholders across PlayStation Studios, including studios, internal service teams, Finance, IT, Information Security and Legal.
Establish and maintain a vendor database (costs, contracts, availability and scorecards). This may include implementing new tools and systems.
Develop a risk mitigation strategy across the studio portfolio.
Ongoing responsibility for supplier relationship management, contract renewals and performance reviews; own the resourcing lifecycle key interaction points.
Maintain a good awareness of partner performance across the portfolio, promoting good development partners internally, and assisting studios with performance issues.
Proactively keep well-informed of industry trends and undertaking market research.

QUALIFICATIONS 

10+ years’ experience in game development, with at least 5 years in outsource/co-development management in a large organization.
Deep knowledge of game development cycles and dependencies.
An established and existing partner industry network in the AAA space.
Knowledgeable and up to date on the partner landscape and trends.
Strong business acumen to negotiate terms and deals.
Experience working with Legal to get contracts drafted.
Strong stakeholder management skills, ability to build strong working relationships, demonstrate diplomacy and level with people of different backgrounds and cultures (internally and externally).
Organizational skills and patience in new and challenging scenarios where processes need to be established.
Tactful and cooperative in complicated situations.
Ability to drive a culture of continuous service improvement.
Facilitation experience.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written skills.
Quantitative analytical skills.

Please note we are open to remote work, globally for this role.  This role is not solely based in Canada, U.S., Netherlands or the UK.

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.
We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.
PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

demographic_questions.description:
Voluntary Self-Identification

Our vision at PlayStation is to bring out the best in our global team members by creating a sense of belonging, being a place where they can grow, and ensuring everyone feels valued, heard, and supported so we can push the boundaries of play. That vision begins our candidates, and we are working to better understand the diversity of our candidate population.  
 
This data will also be aggregated and sent to the government for reporting purposes. Please know that the completion of this form is entirely voluntary. Your personally identifiable information (name, address, etc) will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you choose to provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file for XX time.

 

Protected Veteran

You are a “protected veteran” under United States law if any of the following apply to you:

  • Disabled Veteran: a veteran of the U.S. military who is entitled to compensation (or who would be entitled to compensation if not for the receipt of military retired pay) under the administration of the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and/or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. 
  • Recently Separated Veteran: a veteran who has discharged or released from active duty in the U.S. military within the last three years.
  • Armed Forces Service Medal Veteran: a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, participated in a U.S. military operation for which an Armed Forces Service Medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.

 

Disability

Under U.S. law, you are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.

Identifying yourself as an individual with a disability is voluntary, and we hope that you will choose to do so. Your answer will be maintained confidentially and will not be seen by selecting officials or anyone else involved in making personnel decisions, nor will it be shared with our accommodations team . Completing the form will not negatively impact you in any way, regardless of whether you have self-identified in the past.
